title: Missouri Freedom of Information Act. Request: Missouri Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of Missouri-Columbia)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Missouri Freedom of Information Act. Request: Missouri Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of Missouri-Columbia)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Missouri Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.subject: MR#34570-345685 - Freedom of Information Request: Aldo Moro
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

Aldo Romeo Luigi Moro (23 September 1916 – 9 May 1978) was an Italian statesman and politician, and a prominent member of the Christian Democracy party. He served as 38th Prime Minister of Italy, from 1963 to 1968, and then from 1974 to 1976. He was one of Italy's longest-serving post-war Prime Ministers, holding power for a combined total of more than seven years.

Proof of death is not required as his death has been widely reported on:

http://www.history.com/this-day-in-history/aldo-moro-found-dead
https://www.theguardian.com/theguardian/2013/may/08/aldo-moro-red-brigades-1978
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/1581425/US-envoy-admits-role-in-Aldo-Moro-killing.html

In addition please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Joseph Lloyd
An acknowledgement letter, stating the request is being processed.

communications.subject: Follow-up on FOIA Request NLRB-2023-001998 (NxGen participant info)
communications.communication:
CAUTION: This email and any attachments may contain Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI). National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) regulations at 32 CFR Part 2002 apply to all executive branch agencies that designate or handle information that meets the standards for CUI.

I'm working on FOIA request NLRB-2023-001998 for "all non-exempt fields of the participant and participant_party tables from the NxGen case management system database."

NxGen designates participants to have one of four roles:

  *   Primary: This is usually the main address of the facility as designated on the charge or petition
  *   Legal Rep: Legal representation for the primary participant
  *   Additional Service: These are people who would be like a cc in letters,  or it could be a secondary address for someone.  For example: many union reps list their official business address as primary, and because they might be located in a remote area or working from home, they have a secondary address or home address listed as an additional service.
  *   Notification: This are the national or international union headquarters.  To become a notification, the organization has to file Form 4702 annually, and the notification party only receives a copy of the charge or petition.

Participants also have distinct roles: Employer, Union, Individual, and Union as an Employer.

NxGen further designates participants as: Charging Party, Charged Party/Respondent, Involved Party, Petitioner, Intervenor, Employer, and Amicus.

Instead of providing a dump of all the participants in the system, and in order to provide the most relevant case information, my recommendation for participants is to provide the Primary participant information (entity name and address) and exclude the Legal Reps, Additional Services, and Notifications.  Also, because the participant tables do not contain any other case-specific information besides the case number, I would recommend including the case name, date filed, date closed, and case closing reason.  I also recommend information for individual charging parties/petitioners be listed simply as the party type of "Individual" and to exclude individuals' personal address  information from your request (we would withheld it per Exemptions 6 and 7(C) if it's not specifically excluded.)  Further, I would also recommend excluding Amicus information since cases can only have Amicus filings if the Board approves it.

Sample R case info:
Case Number
Case Name
Case Filed Date

Closed Reason

Are my recommendations and the above sample format acceptable to you?  Also, do you have a specific case filed timeframe, or do you want everything in NxGen?  Some of the older cases before FY2011 do not have participant info, but I can pull whatever we have if you want it.



Jodilyn M. Breirather, FOIA Specialist
National Labor Relations Board
Division of Legal Counsel
FOIA and Privacy Act Branch
414-930-7208

Please be aware that this email may be subject to public disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act or other authorities, though exceptions may apply for certain case-related information, personal privacy, and other matters.

Just wanted to let you know that the records for this request will be released to you within the hour.  One of the files we’re releasing is too big to be attached to an email, so in addition to making the records available directly in FOIAonline, we’re also going to upload them to a secure NLRB site.  You’ll receive a separate secure email with instructions to access the records on that site.

Just a reminder that FOIAonline is being decommissioned on Saturday, September 30, so any records in that system will no longer be available after that date.  Also, if there is a government shutdown, the secure NLRB file site will be unavailable until funding is restored.

Let me know if you have any questions. ☺

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Owen Brewster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation into Ralph Owen Brewster (February 22, 1888 – December 25, 1961), who represented Maine in the Senate from January 1941 to December 1952. Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

    death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.
    
    Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not
    limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone
    Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and
    the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and
    cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and
    companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite
    locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both
    investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any
    potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to
    NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as
    any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer
    or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the
    Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records
    are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records
    while additional records are located and processed for release.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Paul Galante
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fowen-brewster-139742%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2IK4I9uIAF_1jezhuonG71E%3A1pMg62%3AecHk5-n4th5Lzjjsg8nZDYk22SPUd62Ln3aQEPCd1SM

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1580730-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: FOIA request DOI-FWS-2022-005918
communications.communication:
Dear Jimmy Tobias, DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL. INSTEAD RESPOND TO THE CONTACT LISTED AT THE END OF THIS EMAIL. 
The United States Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS) FOIA office received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request, dated August 31, 2022, and assigned it control number DOI-FWS-2022-005918. Please cite this number in any future communications with our office regarding your request. Fee Category and Fee 
We have classified you as a representative of the news media.  As such, we may charge you for some of our duplication costs, but we will not charge you for our search or review costs; you also are entitled to up to 100 pages of photocopies (or an equivalent volume) for free. See .  If, after taking into consideration your fee category entitlements, our processing costs are less than $50.00, we will not bill you because the cost of collection would be greater than the fee collected. (http://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?c=ecfr&sid=0fc3ab3499768eebc2e3691c8cf88dec&rgn=div5&view=text&node=43:1.1.1.1.2&idno=43#43:1.1.1.1.2.7.5.3) 43 C.F.R. § 2.39 See 43 C.F.R. § 2.37(g) 
You have asked us to waive the fees for processing your request.  Our FOIA regulations state that bureaus will waive, or partially waive, fees if disclosure of all or part of the information is: 
(1) In the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of government operations or activities, and 
(2) Not primarily in your commercial interest. 
See 43 C.F.R. § 2.45(a).  Our FOIA regulations also provide four specific criteria that are used to determine whether these two requirements are met.  See (http://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?c=ecfr&sid=0fc3ab3499768eebc2e3691c8cf88dec&rgn=div5&view=text&node=43:1.1.1.1.2&idno=43#43:1.1.1.1.2.7.5.9) 43 C.F.R. § 2.48(a).  Your request meets the requirements, and your fee waiver has been granted. (http://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?c=ecfr&sid=0fc3ab3499768eebc2e3691c8cf88dec&rgn=div5&view=text&node=43:1.1.1.1.2&idno=43#43:1.1.1.1.2.7.5.12) Multitrack Processing 
We use Multitrack Processing to process FOIA requests.  The Simple track is for requests that would generally take one to five workdays to process.  The Normal track is for requests that would generally take six to twenty workdays to process.  The Complex track is for requests that would generally take twenty-one to sixty workdays to process.  The Extraordinary track is for requests that would generally take more than sixty workdays to process.  The Expedited track is for requests that have been granted expedited processing, which are processed as soon as practicable.  Within each track, requests are usually processed on a first-in, first-out basis. Your request falls into the Complex processing track. For additional information please feel free to contact us at fwhq_foia@fws.gov or by phone at 916-414-6682. (mailto:fwhq_foia@fws.gov)

title: 18-0693 Body Cam Records Request for Case Involving Officer Daniel Russo

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: 18-0693 Body Cam Records Request for Case Involving Officer Daniel Russo
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Under the New York Open Records Act, §86(3)-87 et seq., I am requesting police records of the Rochester Police, specifically incident number CR#17-084858 also referred to as case number 18-0693. The officer involved in this incident was  Daniel  Russo.  My request includes but is not limited to documents, incident reports, multimedia, body-worn camera footage, arrest filings, and other documentation linked to the incident. It also includes all documents, notes, correspondence, and memoranda evidencing sustained findings reports, and investigations, and all communication and correspondence in whatever tangible medium between the officials, the victims, and the overseeing agency.

As per law, police misconduct records are public records and do not qualify for any exemption, and are not listed as confidential records.

This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show the following:

A CPS directory listing school/unit, title, phone number and e-mail address for each CPS official, staff or employee with an email address. This request includes board members, subcommittee members, part-time employees, parent workers and any person issued a CPS email address.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=14196

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N014196-091223
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

09/13/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR151916 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014196-091223 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
() there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. 

Sincerely, 

Patricia Majchrowicz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N014196-091223
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
09/27/2023 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Mr./Ms. Bhimani: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014196-091223 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please be advised that contact information for each Board member can be found on the Board's website by using this link and scrolling down to "Meet the Board:" https://www.cpsboe.org/ Please also be advised that subcommittee members can be found by searching through Board reports and agendas on the District's website by using this link: https://www.cpsboe.org/ Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/8.5(a), a public body is not required to copy a public record that is published on the public body's website. However, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/8.5(b), if you are unable to reasonably access the record online after being directed to the website, please re-submit your request and state your inability to reasonably access the record(s) online. Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

09/13/2023 

Anthony Moser 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR151854 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Anthony: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014195-091223 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
() there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. 

Sincerely, 

Patricia Majchrowicz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that the Facilities department began using this form in September 2021. Please also note that certain private information (personal cell phone numbers/email addresses and usernames) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: 
Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 Fax: 217-782-1396 E-mail: publicaccess@atg.state.il.us You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, 
Patricia Majchrowicz FOIA Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Institutional Press Policies (National Park College (arkansas))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy, guidance, handbook, manual, or standard contract concerning the institution’s interactions or relationship with members of the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

2. Any policy, guidance, handbook, or manual concerning the interactions or communications of institutional employees, including faculty, administrators, staff, and student employees, with the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. This request concerns a matter of public interest. The records are sought for the purpose of researching and educating the public about policies affecting student journalists' ability to engage in news gathering and reporting on college and university campuses.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Anne Marie Tamburro.

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

You kindly sent us copies of your records that show information as listed below dated to March 31 2023. Please will it be possible to have an update on any records that would show some or all of the following information:

1. A list of ALL hedge funds and fund of hedge funds in which Richmond Retirement System is an investor; and

2. For each hedge fund and fund of hedge funds, may I please have a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information:

a. the month by month market value of Richmond Retirement System's holding in each fund from January 1 2023 to June 30 2023,

b. the month by month amount invested by Richmond Retirement System in each fund from January 1 2023 to June 30 2023,

c. the month by month net returns (net of fees) earned by Richmond Retirement System on its investment in each fund from January 1 2023 to June 30 2023

Additionally we are missing the December 2022 data so we would be grateful if you could include this information aswell.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available

Nanette Lee

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Haley Parker.

Kia Johnson
FOIA officer

title: Rwanda Habyarimana Assassination and RPF killings

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Rwanda Habyarimana Assassination and RPF killings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents in the possession of the United States Department of State created between April 6, 1994 and October 1, 1994 related to the assassination of Rwandan President Habyarimana; related to missiles fired in Rwanda on April 6, 1994; related to the a massacre in Byumba in April 1994; and any killings by the Rwandan Patriotic Front at Gabiro, Akagera, Kibungo, and Butare between April 6, 1994 and October 1, 1994. 
 
This request includes the following categories of documents: cables to and from the U.S. Mission in Rwanda, Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, Burundi, the Democratic Republic of the Congo (then known as “Zaire”), and the State Department headquarters in Washington D.C.; reports prepared by the U.S. Mission to the United Nations; talking points prepared for U.S. diplomats at the United States Mission to the United Nations; talking points prepared by regional diplomats in U.S. Mission in Rwanda, Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, Burundi, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo (then known as “Zaire”) for use with local and regional officials; field assessments or other reports completed by U.S. diplomats in U.S. Mission in Rwanda, Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, Burundi, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo (then known as “Zaire”); communications between U.S. diplomats and officials at the White House, Department of Defense, or intelligence community; internal legal assessments or determinations by the NSC or State Department Office of the Legal Adviser; reports or other recommendations prepared by the State Department Office of Policy Planning; and any after the fact reviews conducted by the U.S. Department of State.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Benedict Moran

communications.subject: Ref: F-2023-02368, Freedom of Information Act Acknowledgement
communications.communication: **THIS EMAIL BOX IS NOT MONITORED, PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL.** Mr.Moran: This email acknowledges receipt of your December 4, 2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552) request received by the U.S. Department of State, Office ofInformation Programs and Services on December 5, 2022, regardingdocuments related to the assassination of Rwandan President Habyarimana, missiles fired in Rwanda on April 6, 1994, the a massacre in Byumba in April 1994, and any killings by the Rwandan Patriotic Front at Gabiro, Akagera, Kibungo, and Butare between April 6, 1994 and October 1, 1994; cables to and from the U.S. Mission in Rwanda, Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, Burundi, the Democratic Republic of the Congo (then known as “Zaire”), and the State Department headquarters in Washington D.C., reports prepared by the U.S. Mission to the United Nations, talking points prepared for U.S. diplomats at the United States Mission to the United Nations, talking points prepared by regional diplomats in U.S. Mission in Rwanda, Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, Burundi, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo (then known as “Zaire”) for use with local and regional officials; field assessments or other reports completed by U.S. diplomats in U.S. Mission in Rwanda, Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, Burundi, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo (then known as “Zaire”); communications between U.S. diplomats and officials at the White House, Department of Defense, or intelligence community, internal legal assessments or determinations by the NSC or State Department Office of the Legal Adviser; reports or other recommendations prepared by the State Department Office of Policy Planning, and any after the fact reviews conducted by the U.S. Department of State (Date Range for Record Search: From 4/6/1994 To 10/1/1994). Unless you advise otherwise, we will treat as non-responsive any compilations of publicly available news reports and any publicly available documents not created by the U.S. government, such as mass-distribution emails from news media.  This Office assigned your request the subject reference number and placed it in the complex processing track where it will beprocessed as quickly as possible.  See 22 CFR § 171.11(h). This Office willnot be able to respond within the 20 days provided by the statute due to“unusual circumstances.” See 5 U.S.C. §552(a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii). In this instance,the unusual circumstances include the need to search for and collect requestedrecords from other Department offices or Foreign Service posts. If you have any questions regarding yourrequest , would like to narrow the scope or arrange analternative time frame to speed its processing, or would like an estimated dateof completion, please contact our FOIA Requester Service Center or our FOIAPublic Liaison by email at FOIAstatus@state.gov or telephone at202-261-8484.  Additionally, youmay contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at theNational Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIAmediation services they offer. Thecontact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government InformationServices, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS,College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, email at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. **THIS EMAIL BOX IS NOT MONITORED, PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL.**

communications.subject: Ref: F-2023-02371, Freedom of Information Act Acknowledgement
communications.communication: **THIS EMAIL BOX IS NOT MONITORED, PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS EMAIL.** Mr.Moran: This email acknowledges receipt of your December 4, 2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552) request received by the U.S. Department of State, Office ofInformation Programs and Services on December 5, 2022, regardingdocuments regarding the United Nations investigations into crimes allegedly committed by the Rwandan Patriotic Front before and during the Rwanda Genocide, between April 6, 1994 and December 31, 2003; including memos, talking points, reports, inter-agency communications, legal assessments, policy recommendations, notes and other records of meetings with foreign officials, and other documents that document the position of United States State Department and the United States Mission to the United Nations on the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda's (“UN ICTR”) decision to investigate the RPF; the launching of a, “Special Investigations Unit,” within the UN ICTR to investigate the RPF; and the subsequent decision to shut down the Special Investigation Unit without pursuing any alleged crimes committed by the RPF;  also including memos, talking points, reports, inter-agency communications, legal assessments, policy recommendations, notes and other records of meetings with foreign officials, and other documents that state the position of the United States State Department and the United States Mission to the United Nations on the vote of the United Nations Security Council to remove Carla del Ponte as Chief Prosecutor of the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda (1999-2003) (Date Range for Record Search: From 4/6/1994 To 12/31/2003). Unless you advise otherwise, we will treat as non-responsive any compilations of publicly available news reports and any publicly available documents not created by the U.S. government, such as mass-distribution emails from news media.  This Office assigned your request the subject reference number and placed it in the complex processing track where it will beprocessed as quickly as possible. communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FAA Records - Jeffrey Epstein
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records submitted by or concerning Jeffrey Edward Epstein, an owner of private aircraft. Epstein's date of birth was January 20, 1953 . The first 5 digits of his Social Security Number were 090-44.

Include all records related to at least two aircraft known to be connected to Epstein: N908JE (registered to JEGE INC) ; N909JE (registration unknown); and N212JE (registered to JEGE LLC and PLAN D LLC).  Include all inquiries to the FAA and answers from the FAA for information requests on Epstein or the listed aircraft from a U.S. Cabinet Department (e.g., Department of Justice),  federal agency (e.g., Federal Bureau of Investigation), or from a state or local law enforcement agency (e.g., NYPD).

Please conduct a search of all systems of records for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, agencies and companies. FAA systems of records of interest include (but are not limited to): DOT/FAA 801 – Aircraft Registration Records; DOT/FAA 813 - Civil Aviation Security System; DOT/FAA 815 - Investigative Record System; DOT/FAA 845 - Administrators Correspondence Control and Hotline Information System, ACCIS, Administrator’s Hotline Information System, AHIS, and Consumer Hotline Information System, CHIS; and DOT/FAA 847 - Aviation Records on Individuals. 

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that FAA has no other copies of said records.

EPSTEIN is widely reported to have died 8/10/2019 in New York City (see attached article from the NY Times). Records concerning Epstein as a subject should thus be assumed free from FOIA Exemption 6, 7(C) and the Privacy Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records: Sea Launch
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All FAA records mentioning or pertaining to the Commercial Space Transportation License for Sea Launch, which is assigned the license number LLO 02-066 by the Office of Commercial Space Transportation.

This includes the original application for this license; all subsequent revisions submitted by members of the corporate consortia that have held this license; all required disclosures, such as proofs of insurance and  reports of the Sea Launch Environmental Monitoring and Protection Plan; all submissions pursuant to launches by the licensee; all safety inspection data; and all findings and reports related to accident or near-miss reporting in the Aviation Safety Reporting System.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the FAA has no other copies of said records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2020-007049
communications.communication:
re: FOIA request  # 2020-007049 ("Records: Sea Launch")

To whom it may concern:

This is in response to the emails of Lina Garcia and Brian Rushforth regarding the above-captioned FOIA request.

I am more than happy to hear from the FAA on its concerns regarding the scope of the request. However, I must insist that this communication format (email) is best for the deliberate process of dealing with those concerns. Please state them in writing. I will listen.

I hope that this clarifies issues, and look forward to the agency's response.

- T. McElwee

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2020-007049
communications.communication:
Dear Sir or Madam:

There are several issues.

First, what you are requesting is a very, very large search.  All records pertaining to Sea Launch, it’s license, safety inspections, etc. is potentially thousands of dollars in search and review.  To the extent we can narrow down “all records mentioning or pertaining to” on this licensee, that would help.

Secondly, many of the records are physical, and again the search and duplication required will be substantial. In addition, our offices are currently closed to non-essential personnel due to COVID-19.

On the environmental documents, many of those were formally publicly available, so we are moving those to FAA FOIA Library.  When they are online, we can let you know.  There is no charge for those.

Finally, we would be unable to find responsive records in the Aviation Safety Reporting System, a system run by NASA.  ASRS records are voluntary reported and de-identified before they arrive to FAA systems.

If you do not wish to modify the scope, we will conduct a full estimate of the cost of the search for your review and approval.

I have found that when working with the public, media, and others on scope issues, it’s a lot easier to have conversation about it, and then follow up with an email for the record.  If you would like to do that, I’m happy to talk.

Sincerely,

Brian Rushforth
Chief of Staff
Office of Commercial Space Transportation
Federal Aviation Administration
(202) 267-9617

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2020-007049
communications.communication:
Dear Sir or Madam:

As we’ve had no response from you on the scoping of this request, we are closing this FOIA request.

Sincerely,

Brian Rushforth
Chief of Staff
Office of Commercial Space Transportation
Federal Aviation Administration
(202) 267-9617

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

On behalf of the district's Public Records Officer Simone Neal, and pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this email acknowledges receipt of the public records request you submitted to the Mukilteo School District on December 8, 2022.  Specifically, you requested:

"Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

"Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022."

The district is processing your request.  The district anticipates that the first installment of records responsive to your request will be available no later than February 1, 2023.  This additional time is necessary, per RCW 42.56.520, to locate and assemble the information requested, to determine whether any of the information you requested is exempt from public disclosure and produce a corresponding exemption log, and to notify any third party affected by the request.  As documents responsive to your request are ready for disclosure, they will be provided to you.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney
Director of Human Resources
Mukilteo School District
9401 Sharon Drive
Everett, Washington 98204
425-356-1298
barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu<mailto:barneykd@mukilteo.wednet.edu>
Pronouns: he/him/his

Employment Opportunities - https://www.mukilteoschools.org/Page/937

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

In my December 15, 2022, email to you in response to your December 8, 2022 request for records, I estimated the first installment of those records would be available to you by February 1, 2023.

In our subsequent search for records, we have found over 23,300 email records that may be responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

With the way your request is worded and in order to provide you with all the emails you are requesting, we will need to review each one of the 23,300 records to determine if they are responsive and possibly make redactions to the records.  This will take a significant amount of time.  Therefore, we invite you to narrow your request.  Are there any more specific terms you would like to provide regarding specific complaints or individuals for whom you are looking for records?

If you would like to proceed with your request as written, please let me know and I will update the expected timeline for processing the request.  I look forward to receiving a reply from you about how you would like to proceed with your request.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

Per RCW 42.56. 250(12), I am providing you with a copy of the third party notification to Ms. Carnahan (formerly Donovan), as attached hereto.

Please note, the record has been redacted per RCW 42.56.230(3).  Ms. Carnahan's personal email address has been redacted because disclosing it would violate her right to privacy.  Please also note that, due to a delay in providing the notification and the need to provide her with 10 days' notice before releasing the records, our initial installment of responsive records will be delayed approximately one week, to February 9,, 2023.

Finally, please see my previous email below regarding a possible narrowing of the other item from your December 8, 2022 request, to which you have not yet responded.  Have a good day.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Francisco Gomez and Amber Donovan
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

Attached is the first installment of records responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022."  A redaction log is also included.

The district will continue its search for records for this request and also for "Any records or emails pertaining to Cisco Gomez. Focusing in on his position as Maintenance and Grounds Supervisor. Looking for information related to complaints about him from staff. Include any emails from John Mannix, Karen Mooseker, Keith Stefenson and District Office staff that have anything to do about any complaints from staff against Cisco Gomez. Between the years of 2015 to 2022."

As another reminder, on January 25 I invited you to narrow your search to help expedite the search for records responsive to the Cisco Gomez item above.  After further searching, we have reduced the number of potentially responsive email records to 12,810, which will take a significant amount of time to review.  Absent an updated request to revise our search, we will continue to search based on your original request.

At this time. we anticipate a second installment of records will be sent to you no later than April 1, 2023.

Sincerely,

Kirk Barney

communications.subject: Response to Request for Records Final Installment
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sites,

In response to your request for records dated December 8, 2022, the district is providing you with a final installment of records. The records include emails regarding an investigation which is responsive to your request for "Any records or emails pertaining to Amber Donovan that have anything to do with lewd texting and videos being sent to subordinates. Focusing in on her position as Custodial manager, Coordinator. Between the years of 2020 to 2022." An exemption log accompanies the records.

The files are too large to send through the district email system. I have placed them in a shared Google folder at this link<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1ePO1abTLfGk68b0UmSOnUgGhgkZ72DXr?usp=drive_link>. You may access, view and download the records. Be sure to save them for your use. The folder will remain accessible for 30 days or until October 26, 2023.

Let me know if you have any questions about the records.

With this response, the district considers this request closed.

Sincerely,

Tammy Bengen, Executive Assistant for

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: LAUSD Contractor Protocol
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents pertaining to each Department's, each Division's, protocols, requirements, SOP's, regarding the payment of LAUSD contractors, day laborers, and vendors.
Scans in PDF format of the complete manual for software or all methods of payment transmittal. 
For instances where schools or the District (LAUSD) pays contractors, day laborers, vendors, in person or by mail I request documents scanned to PDF format displaying standard operating protocols, requirements, procedures as well. This should be done on a school by school basis with point of contact, and where all necessary by Department with point of contact.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf

communications.subject: Auto Reply
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email is in response to your California Public Records Act (PRA) request.  Your request will be reviewed and the appropriate departments contacted to determine if disclosable records relevant to your request exist.

As required under California Code section 7922.535(a), the Los Angeles Unified School District (District) will make a determination within 10 days as to whether or not a request is seeking records that are publicly disclosable and, if so, to provide the estimated date that the records will be made available.  There is no requirement for a public agency to actually produce the records within 10 days of receiving a request, unless the requested records are readily available.  Still, the District prides itself on always providing all publicly disclosable records in as timely a manner as possible.

Should you have any questions, please contact the Office of the General Counsel at (213) 241-7600.

Thank you.

PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS EMAIL.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Search Warrant records (Chicago Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records related to all search warrants executed between Jan 2012 and the date of processing this request:

IR #
Search Warrant #
Type of Warrant
Search Warrant Date
Search Warrant Requested Address
Search Warrant Execution Address
Complaint For Search Warrant Date
Whether Arrest Occurred
Requesting Officer
Approving Watch Commander
District/Unit
Recovery (Y/N)
Arrest (Y/N)
Name of Judge Who Approved
Time of Judge Approval
Whether Contraband Found in Unusual Location
Whether a Warrant Team Vest Was Used

The records for this request exist in CLEAR, and the processing of this request should be handled nearly identically to P494685, with the exception of the new requested fields: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/chicago-169/search-warrant-log-chicago-police-department-73550/

The information from this request may require the drafting of SQL, as has been done in the past for similar requests. 

To be clear, 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matt Chapman

The information responsive to this request is far too important for the public's understanding of CPD's activities, and as such, I am not interested in reducing the scope of this request. In your continued handling of this request, bear in mind that your department has passed the statutory time limit that allows the use of the unduly burdensome exemption.

I look forward to receiving these records ASAP.

communications.subject: Search warrant help.
communications.communication:
Hello, 

I recently did a google search of city of Chicago search warrants and came across your FOIA request from the city of Chicago. 

My daughter was a victim of the Chicago police because of the way they obtained the search warrant.

Is there a way you can please help me get all the actual complaints for search warrants and search warrants that involve the 25th and 14th districts in Chicago, IL.

The officers involved were Ivan Ramos who is a sergeant who approved the warrants. (37 year old who was promoted by merit votes who runs a tactical team) Samantha Grazziano who wrote the complaint for the warrant (4 year police officer who is on a tactical team) and judge Ursula Walowski who signed the warrant. 

Ivan ramos gets most of his warrants signed by Judge  Ursula Walowski who lives in the northwest side of Chicago where a lot of Chicago cops live. Her son goes to a private catholic school named St. Thecla where many Chicago police officers children attend as well.

Samantha Grazziano who wrote the complaint for the search warrant lives about 2 miles from the judge Ursula Walowski.

Samantha Grazziano’s best friend who is also a Chicago police officer mother who was a Chicago police officer Elizabeth Mcghee lives like 4 blocks away from Judge Ursula Walowski.

I don’t have any concrete proof as of yet about how they conspire but I have a feeling that either Ursula Walowski is rubber stamping the search warrants or the officers are forging her signature.

I know it’s kind of unbelievable but I do have proof that is public record of an officer that was forging Judge Ursula Walowski’s signature so that he would be approved overtime hours that he never worked for.

Can you please get back to me as I’m in desperate need to gather proof that would help my daughters case so she can be set free.

Thank you,
Dominick P.
Sent from my iPhone

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: P561364-013020
communications.communication:
Dear Matt : 
Thank you for your interest in information from the Chicago Police Department. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: P561364-013020 
You have requested the following records: Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All names of all CLEAR modules.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matt Chapman, as Lucy Parsons Labs 
Chicago Police Department (CPD) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the Chicago FOIA Center. 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Chicago Public Safety Record System. On Jan. 30, 2020:
Subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: P561364-013020
Dear Matt : 
Thank you for your interest in information from the Chicago Police Department. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: P561364-013020 
You have requested the following records: Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:
All names of all CLEAR modules.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.
I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Matt Chapman, as Lucy Parsons Labs

title: Long Beach Fire Department Sworn Employees Zip Codes

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Long Beach Fire Department Sworn Employees Zip Codes
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

—Documents sufficient to show the zip code and city of residence of every sworn employee of the Long Beach Fire Department.*

*I have made this same request of the LBPD as PRA request P005736 (filed January 6, 2021, fulfilled August 31, 2021). The LBPD responded by providing a PDF with two columns (city and zip code) and a row for each officer. The LBPD data shows 81.5% of officers commute from outside Long Beach—many from Covid-19 hotspot in Orange County and one from as far away as Texas. 

This request is in line with the precedent the ACLU and LA Times have established with the LAPD's public records department.  If you prefer not to make a seperate list, I will accept a redacted copy of the LBFD call-out roster or other such document. 

The requested data will be made available to the general public and will appear in the Beachcomber and other media outlets as part of their reporting on the Public Safety Unions' opposition to Covid-19 public health measures. This request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Greg Buhl

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: C012519-100321
communications.communication:
Dear Greg Buhl: 
 
Thank you for submitting a request for public records to the City of Long Beach. Pursuant to California Government Code § 6253, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine whether responsive records exist. 
If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10). 
You may be contacted by a City staff member if there are questions regarding your request. 
Thank you again for contacting the City of Long Beach. You may track the status of your request here in My Request Center.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: C012519-100321
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: Public Records Request Reference Number: C012519-100321 
Thank you for submitting your request for public records.  Occasionally, we experience a delay in searching for records.  Consequently, pursuant to Government Code 6253 (c), the City of Long Beach is extending the time within which to identify responsive documents by fourteen (14) calendar days. 
The City will make every effort to provide responsive records in a reasonable time.  You will be notified by October 28, 2021 of the following: 
 
  * Whether the City has records responsive to your request, and the page count and required payment, if applicable, to produce copies of such records, and/or 
  * Whether the City has records responsive to your request, but which are exempt from disclosure and the reasons for exemption. 
If you have any questions, please contact the Records Coordinator Office at (562) 570-6711.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: C012519-100321
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: Public Records Request Reference Number: C012519-100321 
Dear Greg Buhl, 
In response to PRA # C012519-100321 received on 10/3/2021, the City of Long Beach has determined that responsive records exist and will be disclosed.  City staff is working on compiling and reviewing the appropriate documents and will produce them promptly within a reasonable time frame. Staff will notify you upon producing records if portions of documents will be withheld from disclosure due to exemptions in accordance with law. 
Thank you for contacting the City of Long Beach.  If you have any questions, please call (562) 570-6680. 
Thank you,

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Emails Between Trunco & Walsh 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Emails between Niles-Maine District Library board trustee Jason Trunco and attorney Dennis Walsh between July 1 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

Emails between Niles-Maine District Library board trustee Carolyn Drblik and attorney Dennis Walsh between July 1 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Emails Between Trunco & Walsh 2023

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Emails Between Trunco & Walsh 2023
communications.communication:
Niles-Maine District Library
FOIA Office
6960 Oakton Street
Niles, IL 60714

September 5, 2023



Thank you for writing to the Niles-Maine District Library with your request for information pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. (“FOIA”). On August 28, 2023 the Library received your FOIA in which you requested:

Emails between Niles-Maine District Library board trustee Jason Trunco and attorney Dennis Walsh between July 1 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

Emails between Niles-Maine District Library board trustee Carolyn Drblik and attorney Dennis Walsh between July 1 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).
Pursuant to Section 3(e) of FOIA, the Library is extending its time to respond to your August 28, 2023 FOIA request by five (5) business days to September 12, 2023.
Regards,
Victoria Pichla Luz
FOIA Officer

communications.subject: RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Emails Between Trunco & Walsh 2023
communications.communication:
September 11, 2023

Filed via MuckRock.com
E-mail (Preferred): 151292-33902133@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:151292-33902133@requests.muckrock.com>

Good morning,

We have received your Freedom of Information Act request dated August 28, 2023. In it you request:

Emails between Niles-Maine District Library board trustee Jason Trunco and attorney Dennis Walsh between July 1 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

Emails between Niles-Maine District Library board trustee Carolyn Drblik and attorney Dennis Walsh between July 1 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates).

communications.subject: Your City of Albuquerque public records request #23-6723 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of Albuquerque ************************************************************************ Your record request #23-6723 has been submitted successfully. Greetings:   We have received your request for public records and will begin processing your request. This correspondence is intended to acknowledge your request and alert you that it may take up to fifteen days to process your request. NMSA 1978 14-2-8(D). We will be in contact with you as we process your request if we need additional information or if it appears that your request is excessively burdensome and broad. Please be advised, if you are requesting lapel and/or 911 audio from the Albuquerque Police Department (APD), your request may take a significant amount of time to review and provide the records. In lieu of the 911 audio, my office can provide the Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD). The CAD provides information of when the call was received, when and what officers were dispatched, and a description of what happens throughout the incident. In addition, please keep in mind a 5 minute lapel video can take up to 20 minutes to review depending on the type of redactions that are necessary to complete. Please do not hesitate to contact us if you would like to know the status of your request, and please communicate all questions and status updates via NextRequest. You may access your request by signing into your NextRequest profile at the following website:   https://nextrequest.cabq.gov/users/sign_in    If you have not created a profile, go to the following link:   https://nextrequest.cabq.gov/sign_in_help Sincerely,   Ethan Watson City Clerk ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Albuquerque.

communications.subject: FOIA:  DOI-USGS-2023-004943:  Acknowledgment of your FOIA request
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Welsh: 
On June 6, 2023, the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) office received your FOIA request dated June 6, 2023, and assigned it control number DOI-USGS-2023-004943.  Please cite this number in any future communications with our office regarding your request.  You request the following information: 
All video and image drone footage recorded during the October 2022 unmanned aerial vehicle missions in and around the Assateague Island National Seashore. 
The mission was disclosed in a flight log released via a prior FOIA request. A series of missions were recorded with the RIDs of: 
R_3dTivlqY6ccKVd7 
R_1obtsFMoC2O4CCQ 
R_3q8bodDthaQ7fKl 
R_3Dbc8tOPYfKrF0l 
R_2ciLS3wpACgWlH5 
R_3sp3hquMqPGNvRF 
R_a4fdNfDCML6WL4t 
R_1EibHQceAiE1zG9 
R_3FUlNSqnV21Uj6e 
R_0GqMajZqasDdg9b 
R_BVyrmRoO95ewfAd 
We have classified you as a representative of the “news media” requester.  As such, we may charge you for some of our duplication costs, but we will not charge you for our search or review costs; you also are entitled to up to 100 pages of photocopies (or an equivalent volume) for free. See .  If, after taking into consideration your fee category entitlements, our processing costs are less than $50.00, we will not bill you because the cost of collection would be greater than the fee collected. (http://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?c=ecfr&sid=0fc3ab3499768eebc2e3691c8cf88dec&rgn=div5&view=text&node=43:1.1.1.1.2&idno=43#43:1.1.1.1.2.7.5.3) 43 C.F.R. § 2.39 See 43 C.F.R. § 2.49(a)(1) .  You can expect to hear from us promptly regarding the outcome of this search. 
You have agreed to pay up to $200.00 for the processing of your request.  If we find that this will not cover the cost of processing your request, we will stop processing your request at the point this amount has been reached and will let you know before we incur additional charges.  You can then either agree to pay the additional amount needed or narrow the scope of your request. 
We use Multitrack Processing to process FOIA requests.  The Simple track is for requests that would generally take one to five workdays to process.  The Normal track is for requests that would generally take six to twenty workdays to process.  The Complex track is for requests that would generally take twenty-one to sixty workdays to process.  The Extraordinary track is for requests that would generally take more than sixty workdays to process.  The Expedited track is for requests that have been granted expedited processing, which are processed as soon as practicable.  Within each track, requests are usually processed on a first-in, first-out basis. 
Your request falls into the Normal processing track.  There are 16 requests pending ahead of yours in our overall processing queue.  Presuming that our current FOIA capacity and burden remain constant, we expect that we will dispatch a determination to you by July 10, 2023. 
You may narrow the scope of your request to obtain quicker processing in your currently-assigned track or move the request into a different track, which may enable us to process it more quickly by communicating with us at foia@usgs.gov. 
The 2007 FOIA amendments created the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) to offer mediation services to resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  Using OGIS services does not affect your right to pursue litigation.  You may contact OGIS in any of the following ways: 
Office of Government Information Services 
National Archives and Records Administration 
8601 Adelphi Road - OGIS 
College Park, MD  20740-6001 
Telephone:  (202) 741-5770 
Fax:  (202) 741-5769 
Toll-free:  1 (877) 684-6448 
E-mail:  ogis@nara.gov 
Web: https://www.archives.gov/ogis (https://www.archives.gov/ogis) 
Please note that using OGIS services does not affect the timing of an appeal with the Department’s FOIA & Privacy Act Appeals Officer. Contact information for the Department’s FOIA Public Liaison, who you may also seek dispute resolution services from, is available at https://www.doi.gov/foia/foiacenters. 
If you have any questions about your request, you may contact me by email at foia@usgs.gov. 
Sincerely, 
Eric J. Darby 
Government FOIA Analyst
