communications.subject: DOI-USGS-2023-004943 - Delayed Processing
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Welsh, 
As of yet, we have been unable to make a determination on your request, DOI-USGS-2023-004943.  Our Subject Matter Experts have located over 50,000-60,000 RGB/multispectral images and multiple videos in response to your FOIA request.  Your request falls into the Normal processing track and there are 8 requests pending ahead of yours in this processing track.  We hope to complete our response to you by September 30, 2023. 
We apologize for this delay.  As we have discussed, you may narrow the scope of your request to obtain quicker processing in your currently assigned track or move the request into a different track (which may have the effect of reducing the cost of processing your request and having it processed more quickly).  You also may agree to an alternative time period for processing by communicating with us, our FOIA Requester Center, or the FOIA Public Liaison.  Contact information for the Department’s FOIA Requester Centers and FOIA Public Liaison is available at https://www.doi.gov/foia/foiacenters . You may also seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS).  If you choose to contact OGIS, you may do so in any of the following ways. 
If you choose to contact OGIS, you may do so in any of the following ways: 
Office of Government Information Services 
National Archives and Records Administration 
8601 Adelphi Road – OGIS

Although we hope you will wait so we can upload the records to our website, you may file an appeal with the Department’s FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer regarding this delay.  If you choose to appeal this delay, you may do so anytime between now and the date we make our determination on the FOIA request.  Appeals arriving or delivered after 5 p.m. Eastern Time, Monday through Friday, will be deemed received on the next workday. Your appeal must be made in writing.  You may submit your appeal and accompanying materials to the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer by mail, courier service, fax, or email.  All communications concerning your appeal should be clearly marked with the words: "FREEDOM OF INFORMATION APPEAL."  You must also include with your appeal copies of all correspondence between you and USGS concerning your FOIA request, including your original FOIA request and USGS's response.  Failure to include with your appeal all correspondence between you and USGS will result in the Department's rejection of your appeal, unless the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer determines (in the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer’s sole discretion) that good cause exists to accept the defective appeal. 
Please include your name and daytime telephone number (or the name and telephone number of an appropriate contact), email address and fax number (if available) in case the FOIA/Privacy Act Appeals Officer needs additional information or clarification of your appeal. communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Institutional Press Policies (Arkansas State University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy, guidance, handbook, manual, or standard contract concerning the institution’s interactions or relationship with members of the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

2. Any policy, guidance, handbook, or manual concerning the interactions or communications of institutional employees, including faculty, administrators, staff, and student employees, with the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. This request concerns a matter of public interest. The records are sought for the purpose of researching and educating the public about policies affecting student journalists' ability to engage in news gathering and reporting on college and university campuses.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Anne Marie Tamburro.

communications.subject: Your FOIA request to Arkansas State
communications.communication:
Ms. Tamburro,

Jeff Hankins, ASU's PIO, contacted me and asked me to submit your request
under my signature, as required by Arkansas law. He told me he was already
at work fulfilling the request but needed it to come directly from me.

Sonny Albarado
Editor-in-Chief
Arkansas Advocate
501-551-8811

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Rental Licensing Program Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (September 2021-September 2023) regarding your residential rental licensing program that will be referred to as "program"  in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Rental Units, Licensing Of" as described in Chapter 96 in Hyattsville city code. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Program including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the Program

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the program

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the program 

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the  program

• all documents concerning the passage of the program and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the program since September 2021 to September 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: City of Hyattsville, MD - Records Information Request Confirmation PIR-2023-132
communications.communication:
City of Hyattsville, MD - Records Information Request Confirmation PIR-2023-132 
  
 Dear Requestor, 
  
 Thank you for submitting a request for records on Wednesday, September 13, 2023 at 11:45 PM (Eastern Standard Time). 
  
 Your request reference number is Request Number: PIR-2023-132 and your security key is 674764. 
  
 Please have both reference numbers available when communicating with our staff regarding your request. 
  
 The City will begin processing your request shortly. Due to the volume of requests received the City anticipates that it will take longer than 10 working days to produce the responsive records. Under the Maryland Public Information Act, the City will provide a response within 30-days of the request. 
  
 The first two hours of search and review are provided free of charge. Fees for time over two hours may vary depending on the time and hourly rates of the individual staff and attorneys who must conduct the review. The City does not yet know whether the records requested will require review time in excess of two hours but will inform you as soon as possible if they do. If any requested records are to be withheld, the City's response will explain the reason for that. 
  
 To communicate with staff regarding your request, please contact the City Clerk's Office at cityclerk@hyattsville.org or call 301--985-5009. 
  
 Thank you,

communications.subject: Police Department :: J011350-071723
communications.communication:
Dear Steve Steve: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of The City of Lacey, WA Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this office on 7/17/2023 and given the reference number J011350-071723 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Body camera footage for Officer Stribling, A.M 0575, and Mullen, J.A 0470 in regard to case 2023-01913, for the incident that they were assigned to on 04/22/2023 at 18.30.
We are representing the attorneys in this case.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Steve with Custard Insurance Adjusters

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flacey-police-department-634%252Funtitled-149436%252F%253Femail%253Dlaceypolice%252540ci.lacey.wa.us&url_auth_token=AACLROCMKCBOwT4tVptGkQb1OQo%3A1qLaR1%3ANFLLx91qSEELigCf1E0RQD_846GR7c7jJ0XTdvCad8o 
Not all public documents are available in electronic format. If the document(s) requested are not available electronically, we will make them available for inspection or by paper copy in accordance with the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
The City of Lacey, WA Police Department

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Charcoal Briquettes (Environmental Protection Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, memoranda, emails, correspondence, meeting notes and minutes, presentations, i.e., powerpoint documents relating to:

charcoal briquettes - labeling, composition, consumer complaints, material safety data sheets (SDS), communications with third-parties.

If any clarification or narrowing of request is needed, please contact me. Thank you very much.

Spencer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Spencer Sheehan

communications.subject: Date Range Needed for FOIA Request EPA-2021-004902
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sheehan, 
This message concerns your Freedom of Information Act request for records related to charcoal briquettes. The EPA is in the process of initiating a document search for records responsive to your request. However, we noticed that the date range was missing from your request. Please provide this information to us at your earliest convenience so that we can proceed with the records search. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me at purifoy.tiffany@epa.gov. (mailto:purifoy.tiffany@epa.gov) 
 
Sincerely, 
Tiffany Purifoy 
Government Information Specialist

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #EPA-2021-004902
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Purifoy,

Thank you for bringing this to my attention. This was one of first FOIA requests I submitted through the Muckrock platform so  did not pay close attention to what was included. 

As for a date range, my goal is not to set a range too big that the job is unmanageable and takes forever.  Also, I don't know what the agency may have, etc.

Let's begin with date range from 1/1/2010 to the present, 7/18/2021 or whatever date I submitted the initial request.

Hopefully this date range is not too wide. If it is too big a time period - it would sweep in thousands of unrelated documents perhaps - let me know and I'll be glad to refine my request. Thank you very much.

Spencer

communications.subject: Extension Letter for EPA-2021-004902
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sheehan: 
This message concerns your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request of June 13, 2021, for records related to charcoal briquettes, as described in your request. 
Pursuant to 40 C.F.R. § 2.104(d), an extension of the due date of your request is necessary due to unusual circumstances. EPA needs additional time to examine a potentially voluminous amount of separate and distinct records, which are requested in a single FOIA and consult with two or more components of the agency having substantial subject matter interest in the records. We anticipate that your request will be completed by October 29, 2021. EPA will submit monthly interim releases of records to you until the completion of your request. 
You may email me at purifoy.tiffany@epa.gov with your response or contact me at (919) 541-0878 if you have any further questions or wish to modify your request. (mailto:purifoy.tiffany@epa.gov) 
Additionally, you may seek dispute resolution services from EPA’s FOIA Public Liaison at hq.foia@epa.gov or (202) 566-1667, or from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS). You may contact OGIS in any of the following ways: email, ogis@nara.gov; telephone, (301) 837-1996 or (877) 684-6448; facsimile (301) 837-0348; or by mail at: 
Office of Government Information Services 
National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510 
8610 Adelphi Road, College Park, MD 20740-6001 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Tiffany Purifoy 
Government Information Specialist
